name: MAS Boston Society
mission: Tarbiya Department Tarbiya aims at rooting the faith, purifying the soul, expanding and refining knowledge/understanding, developing and refining all aspects of character, boosting commitment, building skills, and instilling the discipline necessary to conduct a successful, fulfilling, meaningful, and balanced life of learning, virtue, commitment, and service of Islam and humanity.
theoryOfChange: Developing God-conscious community servants who can benefit all of society through spiritual development, education, and civic engagement.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://masboston.org/donate (Source: https://masboston.org/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: masakin (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 33/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

score_details.score_summary: Muslim American Society - MAS Boston shows strong impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://masboston.org/donate (Source: https://masboston.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: The charity is zakat-eligible and maintains policies for zakat distribution.
The organization reported a program expense ratio of 85.3% and fundraising efficiency of $0.05 per $1 raised.
Donors can contribute through various giving methods and platforms.
The organization reported total revenue of $3,286,832, working capital of 3.2 months, and operates Tarbiya, PACE, and Youth Development programs.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: MAS Boston earns a solid overall standing due to its high program spending and efficient fundraising, though its moderate working capital and data confidence levels suggest room for increased financial transparency.
areas_for_improvement: Working capital sits at 3.2 months, which is below the common nonprofit benchmark for long-term sustainability.
Limited public documentation regarding specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics for impact evaluation.

dimension_explanations.alignment: MAS Boston shows high donor fit for the Muslim community by offering zakat-eligible programs that align with religious and cultural values [1]. The organization addresses urgent community needs through its Public Affairs & Civic Engagement (PACE) and Youth Development initiatives [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high financial efficiency with a program expense ratio of 85.3% and a total revenue of $3,286,832 [2][4]. Its impact is primarily driven by capacity building through the Tarbiya Department, which focuses on purifying the soul and refining knowledge to instill discipline in service of Islam and humanity [4].

baseline_narrative.headline: Muslim American Society - MAS Boston empowers the community through comprehensive spiritual development, youth leadership, and civic engagement.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 85.3%, ensuring the vast majority of funds directly support community services.
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.05 per $1 raised.
Strong focus on holistic spiritual and character development through the Tarbiya Department.
baseline_narrative.summary: MAS Boston is a religious and social services organization dedicated to fostering a balanced life of virtue and service through its Tarbiya, youth development, and public affairs programs [4]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through various giving platforms [1][3].

giving_considerations: Organization has strong program efficiency but limited impact measurement data.

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 85.3%</cite>, ensuring the vast majority of funds directly support community services.
MAS Boston operates with a fundraising cost of only <cite id="2">$0.05 per $1 raised</cite>.
The organization is <cite id="1">zakat-eligible</cite>, serving categories such as fuqara and masakin.

strengths_deep_dive: MAS Boston demonstrates strong financial efficiency, with a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 85.3%</cite> and a fundraising cost of only <cite id="2">$0.05 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization's <cite id="4">total revenue of $3,286,832</cite> supports its mission of spiritual and character development through programs like Tarbiya and youth development.
rich_narrative.summary: Muslim American Society - MAS Boston is a religious and social services organization dedicated to fostering a balanced life of virtue and service through its Tarbiya, youth development, and public affairs programs. The organization reported <cite id="4">$3,286,832 in total revenue</cite> for the 2018 tax year, with a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 85.3%</cite>. MAS Boston is <cite id="1">zakat-eligible</cite>, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through various giving platforms. The organization operates with <cite id="2">exceptional fundraising efficiency</cite>, spending only <cite id="2">$0.05 per $1 raised</cite>.
